c74object.name: j.parameter_array
c74object.digest: Declare an array of model parameters
c74object.description: j.parameter_array declares an array of parameters within a model or patch. Its wraps j.parameter features in a handy external, allowing to manage dynamical sets of parameters of a same kind more easily.
c74object.discussion:
The parameter is an acces point for controlling the processing of the patch. The parameter value can be updated immediately, or by easing over time. Common types of parameters, such as frequency, can be controlled using several different units (e.g. Hz, midinote or midicent) interchangeably.
The value of the parameter can be stored and recalled using model presets. User interfaces can access the parameter remotely. Mappings enable one parameter dynamically control the value of another parameter. Cues can control all parameters in all models. When designing cues, the value can be queried for every single parameter in the patch.
Additionally the parameter enables inter-application communication. The parameter is provided with a unique global OSC address. Parameters can also be declared on the network in order for other applications such as i-score to inspect and control models.

inlet.description: Index of the instance to send value to. (1 to max number of instance. * will send value to all instances)

outlet.description: Parameter's value. When format attribute is set to single (default) output will be the selected instance parameter's value. When format is set to array, output will be a list of all parameters' value.

objarg.name: name
objarg.description: Nodes array name defined using a bracket-based syntaxe: my/message.[2]

method.name: anything
method.digest: Store and output current parameter's value.
method.description: Store and output current parameter's value.

method.digest: Increment the selected instance parameter's value by the amount defined by the @stepsize attribute
method.description: Increment the selected instance parameter's value by the amount defined by the @stepsize attribute

method.digest: Decrement the value by the amount defined by the @stepsize attribute
method.description: Decrement the value by the amount defined by the @stepsize attribute

method.name: address
method.digest: Define an array of parameters in the namespace. Ex: 'address my/message.[5]'
method.description: The address message followed by an osc name containing a number of instances placed in bracket declares an array of parameters in the namespace. Ex: 'address my/message.[5]'

method.name: array
method.digest: Dispatch a list of values to instances of the parameters
method.description: Dispatch a list of values to instances of the parameters

method.name: array/select
method.digest: This message select which instance to address
method.description: This message select which j.parameter_array's instance to address

method.name: dec
method.digest: Decrement the value by the amount defined by the stepsize attribute
method.description: Decrement the value by the amount defined by the stepsize attribute

method.name: inc
method.digest: Increment the value by the amount defined by the stepsize attribute
method.description: Increment the value by the amount defined by the stepsize attribute

method.name: init
method.digest: Reset the selected j.parameter instance to its default value
method.description: Reset the selected j.parameter instance to its default value

attribute.name: clipmode
attribute.digest: Set how values exceeding range will be clipped
attribute.description: Set how values exceeding range will be clipped. Available clipmodes are none, low, high, both, wrap and fold.

attribute.name: dataspace
attribute.description: Dataspace used by the parameter. This enables parameter values to be updated using several alternative units interchangeably, such as degree and radian for the angle dataspace. Available dataspaces are angle, color, distance, gain, none, orientation, position, speed, temperature and time. The default dataspace is none.

attribute.name: default
attribute.description: Defaults value output by j.parameter_array on model initialization. The defaults value can be overridden by the default model preset.

attribute.name: description
attribute.description: Description of what this node controls. The description is used when auto-documenting models.

attribute.name: format
attribute.digest: Format of the values output: single or array
attribute.description: Format of the values output. When set to single (default), output will be the selected instance parameter's value. When set to array, output will be a list of all instances parameter's value.

enum.name: single
enum.digest: Output the selected instance parameter's value
enum.description: Output the selected instance parameter's value

enum.name: array
enum.digest: Output the all instances parameter's value as a list
enum.description: Output the all instances parameter's value as a list

attribute.name: priority
attribute.description: Priority controls in what order several j.parameter obejcts within the same model will initialise and update in response to presets and cues.

attribute.name: ramp/drive
attribute.digest: Set the scheduler driving the ramp
attribute.description: Set the scheduler driving the ramp: none - no ramping permitted, max - using the Max scheduler, and system - using the system clock. In Max it is recommended to use max rather than system.

attribute.name: ramp/function
attribute.digest: Function to be used for ramping
attribute.description: Sets what easing function to use for ramping. A wide range of easing functions as well as windowing functions are available. Please refer to the help file for further details.

attribute.name: ramp/function/parameters
attribute.digest: Get list of configurable parameters for the current ramp function
attribute.description: Get list of configurable parameters for the current ramp function. Certain ramp functions as specified by the @ramp/function attribute have additional configurable parameters that can be changed dynamically to modify the shape of the ramping curve. The message ramp/function/parameters cause j.parameter to output a list of all such parameters from the rightmost outlet, prepended by the symbol ramp/function/parameters. Refer to the help file for j.ramp for an overview of what functions have additional configurable parameters.

attribute.name: range
attribute.description: The expected range of values for this parameter. Depending on @clipmode this might be a recommended or definitive range.

attribute.name: repetitions/filter
attribute.description: Set whether to filter out value repetitions (1) or not (0).

attribute.name: stepsize
attribute.digest: Step size when incrementing or decrementing the parameter value
attribute.description: Stepsize used when incrementing or decrementing the value using one of the messages +, -, inc or dec.

attribute.name: tags
attribute.description: Tags associated with the parameters. This helps documenting the parameters, and is also useful when restricting namespace searches using j.namespace.

attribute.name: type
attribute.description: Datatype of the parameters (decimal, integer, boolean, string, array, generic)

enum.name: generic
enum.digest: Define a value of any kind
enum.description: Stored and output value will be of any kind (including lists combining integers, decimals and symbols)

enum.name: boolean
enum.description: Stored and output value will be either 0 or 1

enum.name: integer
enum.description: Stored and output value will be an integer number (int). Other values get converted to integer

enum.name: decimal
enum.description: Stored and output value will be a decimal number (float)

enum.name: array
enum.digest: Define an array of decimal (float) value
enum.description: Stored and output value will be a list of decimal numbers (float)

enum.name: string
enum.description: Stored and output value will be a string (symbol)
